That's a great plan! Tracking your luxury purchases and setting a rough guideline based on your data will give you a solid foundation for making intentional financial decisions. The hybrid approach you described will provide the flexibility you need to adapt to changing circumstances while still keeping you accountable to your financial goals.

Remember to be patient and kind to yourself throughout the process. It may take some time to develop new habits and adjust to tracking your spending, but it's worth it in the long run.

As you start tracking your luxury purchases, consider the following tips to help you stay on track:

1. **Be consistent**: Try to track your purchases at the same time every day or week to make it a habit.
2. **Be accurate**: Make sure to log every luxury purchase, no matter how small it may seem.
3. **Categorize and tag**: Use categories and tags to help you identify patterns and trends in your spending.
4. **Review regularly**: Schedule regular reviews of your tracking data to identify areas for improvement and adjust your guideline as needed.
5. **Celebrate milestones**: Acknowledge and celebrate your progress along the way, no matter how small it may seem.

By following these tips and staying committed to your hybrid approach, you'll be well on your way to developing healthy financial habits and making intentional decisions about your luxury purchases.

How do you plan to stay motivated and accountable throughout this process?
